checklist.name: Never hardcode secrets/tokens/sensitive information in the Code!
checklist.description: Of course we know better

checklist.name: Check user input to prevent XSS
checklist.description: Check if the user inputted text is has an ill will

checklist.name: Render user input after HTML encoding
checklist.description: Before putting any user provided text into the DOM, should perform HTML ending, so no script will be executed by the browser

checklist.name: Set up content security Policy
checklist.description: Use Content Security Policy (CSP) to reduce the severity of XSS attacks

checklist.name: Use existing library/service to verify CSRF token
Store the CSRF token with user session on server side
checklist.description: The server-side application should verify that the request includes a token which matches the value that was stored in the user's session

checklist.name: Use SameSite cookie restriction to prevent CSRF
checklist.description: Set SameSite restrictions on each cookie you issue

checklist.name: Avoid Third-Party cookies
checklist.description: Third-Party cookies are known for the vulnerability and will be shutdown by major browser providers

checklist.name: Authenticate the user before return the web artifacts
checklist.description: Web artifacts sometimes contains information that hackers can guess the meaning out of.

checklist.name: Set timeouts for browser sessions
Never send sensitive identifier & secrets in URL parameters
checklist.description: Url parameter is not encoded, but the request body is

checklist.name: Never hardcode sensitive information
checklist.description: Again, don't do that

checklist.name: Authenticate the user with every request
User industrial standard and existing service for authentication
checklist.description: For example, OKTA

checklist.name: API key access should have roles that ties to authorization
checklist.description: For example, OKTA

checklist.name: API should have authorization built up against the requester's role
checklist.description: Always attach roles into requester, this will help development too!

checklist.name: API keys should be rotated with fixed amount of time
checklist.description: Will lower the impact in case of a token breach

checklist.name: Validation user input to prevent SQL injections
checklist.description: Be really care when taking in user input as SQL parameters, always validate them

checklist.name: Use HTTPs if possible
checklist.description: Requests are encrypted in HTTPs!

checklist.name: Use most up to date credential generating algorithms
checklist.description: Older generation algorithms are easier to be beaked by hackers.

checklist.name: Never store credentials in plain text
checklist.description: Imaging if you DB is leaked. Don't store plain text!

checklist.name: Use technologies like PGP encryption for files
checklist.description: When store files, encrypt them before storing

checklist.name: Scan random uploaded files
checklist.description: If you allow user to upload files, please scan it for its intention

checklist.name: Implement a good loggers
checklist.description: Logger with important information helps to identify potential hacking activities quickly

checklist.name: Produce logs for every access temptation
checklist.description: Log temptation for both human users as well as Service Accounts

checklist.name: Hooks logs into SIEM systems
checklist.description: SIEM systems will help to identify risks from your logs and notify you

checklist.name: Give minimal access rights for co-workers on infra account
Make sure only necessary people has access to CI/CD credentials
